meanings.definition: To explain away or make excuses for something
meanings.sent1: She tried to gloze her mistake by blaming it on the weather.
meanings.sent2: He always glozes his lateness by saying there was unexpected traffic.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to gloze its broken vase by pretending to be innocent.
meanings.sent4: His ability to gloze his faults made him a master of deception.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to gloze his scandal was quickly uncovered.

meanings.definition: To flatter or deceive with smooth words
meanings.sent1: She would gloze her way into getting what she wanted.
meanings.sent2: He glozed his boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The salesman tried to gloze the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent4: Her sweet words glozed over the harsh truth.
meanings.sent5: The con artist glozed his victims into giving him their life savings.

meanings.definition: A flattering or deceitful speech or action
meanings.sent1: His gloze was so convincing that no one suspected his true intentions.
meanings.sent2: The princess saw through the knight's gloze and refused his offer.
meanings.sent3: The magician's gloze was so charming that the audience believed his tricks were real.
meanings.sent4: Her gloze of innocence fooled many, but not the detective.
meanings.sent5: The villain's gloze of friendship was a facade for his evil plans.
